sentence.Network_en: Britain did not introduce compulsory primary education until 1880.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到1880年，英国才开始实行初等义务教育。

sentence.Network_en: It is absurd to be discussing compulsory redundancy policies for teachers.
sentence.Network_cn: 讨论针对教师的强制裁员政策真是滑稽可笑。

sentence.Network_en: Unions pledged to fight any compulsory redundancies "tooth and nail".
sentence.Network_cn: 工会许诺会“竭尽所能地”阻止任何强制裁员。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (as a noun denoting a legal mandate which had to be obeyed): from medieval Latin compulsorius, from compuls- 'driven, forced', from the verb compellere (see compel)

entry.tran: 强制性的;强迫的；义务的
entry.def: If something is compulsory, you must do it or accept it, because it is the law or because someone in a position of authority says you must.

example.ex: In East Germany learning Russian was compulsory...
Many young men are trying to get away from compulsory military conscription.
example.tran: 很多年轻人试图逃避强制征兵的政策。

stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+puls驱动,推+ory……的→共同推的→强制性的
impulse[v.冲动]+ive……的→adj.易冲动的,感情用事的
repulse[n.&v.驱逐,击退,厌恶]+ive……的→adj.令人厌恶的,驱逐的
com共同+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→共同推→强制
ex出+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→推出去→驱逐
pro向前+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→向前推
re回+puls驱动,推+e→推回去→击退,驱逐
pulse[n.脉搏,脉冲]+ate表动词→v.有规律的振动,[脉]搏动

means.word_mean: （因法律或规则而）必须做的，强制的，强迫的
